We've enhanced the 'Action' building block: You can now group actions in a dropdown menu
You can now use singletons to implement restrictions on tables on the object page
SAP Fiori elements now supports the annotations DataFieldWithIntentBasedNavigation and DataFieldWithAction

: In the list report we now provide keyboard shortcuts to trigger forward path actions, that is, primary actions, such as 'Go'

You can now execute the PrepareAction or global side effects by pressing Enter in draft mode

External navigation now works correctly even for huge data sets

The screen reader now also reads custom messages
We now ensure the message strip remains closed and doesn't reappear when scrolling
We now ensure that the annotation value is no longer considered during xAppState navigation
The FilterBar is now connected to the Table building block at the correct point in time

We now support the usage of constant values in the HeaderInfo title

A grid table on an object page now has the correct number of rows
We now ensure to always show the correct information for a quick view, even if a dynamic semantic object is used
We now use HeaderInfo annotations in the MessageBox of the 'Mass Edit' dialog
We now ensure that the message dialog remains open if there are back-end errors for unbound and static actions

When using empty rows mode, we now provide an option to not show the empty rows in edit mode
We now support strict handling for actions in Changeset mode

We now offer a formatter to hide parts of the DateTimeWithTimezone stamp in custom fields
: We now provide fiscal date formats for the FilterBar and the Field building blocks
: We now provide a 'Copy' button on the list report and the object page that creates a new object using the exact data of the currently selected object

We now allow the building block "ID" to be set as the "for" attribute of variant management
We've added an example to the flexible programming model explorer showing how to get all active filters using the FilterBar API
You can now activate a 'Clear' button in the manifest of the list report that enables users to clear all filter fields
We've implemented the persistence mode on the object page, which ensures the selected table and chart settings are retained during navigation
The pageReadyEventTimeout parameter can now be set in the manifest file to force the pageReady event to fire after a delay
We now show the subtitle and the icon of the app in the navigation menu as defined in the application's manifest

We no longer pass any measures during intent-based navigation

Recalculating Metadata and Resetting Cache Buster Information for SAPUI5 Apps and Components (UI Add-On 2.0 for SAP NetWeaver SP01 or Higher): To recalculate the metadata and to reset the cache buster information, you now can add '/do-update-meta-data' to the URL of your app or component. This replaces '/resetcachebuster' (which is deprecated, but still supported). For more information, see 'SAPUI5 Application Index' in the application help and SAP Note 2187043.

SAPUI5 Application Index (UI Add-On 2.0 for SAP NetWeaver, SP01 and Higher): The index calculation also includes the SAPUI5 distribution layer. For more information, see 'SAPUI5 Application Index' in the SAP Library.

SAPUI5 Application Index (UI Add-On 2.0 for SAP NetWeaver, SP01 and Higher): transport requests checked before calculation in report /UI5/APP_INDEX_CALCULATE. For more information, see 'SAPUI5 Application Index' in the application help.

Automatic Usage of Whitelist Service for Clickjacking Framing Protection in SAPUI5 Apps (UI Add-On for SAP NetWeaver 1.0 SP15 and 2.0 SP02 or Higher, and Corresponding SAP NetWeaver Releases): If configured, the whitelist service for clickjacking framing protection is used to guard SAPUI5 apps. For more information, see SAP Note 2245332. This feature requires the SAPUI5 core 1.34, 1.32.7, or 1.28.22 or higher.

SAPUI5 Application Index REST API (UI Add-On 2.0 for SAP NetWeaver, SP01 and Higher): URL for access was changed to .../sap/bc/ui2/app_index. For more information, see 'Securing  the SAPUI5 Repository' in the SAP Library.
